column4: Hi all.  I am using Xubuntu Precise on my laptop.  I have it wired to my ethernet  via twisted pair, and I'd like to make the laptop into an access point.  I'm not super familiar with linux, I'm still learning... but does anyone know of any software that can help me setup my laptop as an access point, that will allow things like distributing bandwidth among various connections to the access point. etc...
lol You would think a computer would be able to handle the task...
The laptop serves a few purposes. No work arounds
look at the hostapd website/documentation and check if it supports your wifi-chipset
